name: v0.30.0
body:
* Updated to support Bazel 6.1.0.
* Output now conforms to the latest `buildifier`.
* Updated `examples` to latest rules.

name: v0.20.0
body: * Using `jvm_import` instead of `java_import` and `kt_*`

name: v0.19.1
body: * You can now also set `exports` type on specific artifact.

name: v0.19.0
body:
* You can now specify how we generate `exports` attribute:
  * `all` - Generate `exports` for all resolved dependencies.
  * `requested_deps` - (the default) Generate only for top-level, requested, artifacts.
  * `none` - do not generate `exports` attribute in any of the targets.

name: v0.18.1
body: * Fix for test-only marking of inner-deps.

name: v0.18.0
body: * Support for `test_only` artifacts  - such artifacts will be marked as test-only and Bazel will not allow those to be used in production code.

name: v0.17.0
body: * Support for artifacts' target type hint. This may speed up resolution quick a bit for large repos.

name: v0.16.3
body: * Fix for `java_plugin#runtime_dep` mapping

name: v.0.16.2
body: - fix for null licenses

name: v.0.16.1
body:
* Correctly resolve dependencies with a profile-activation mechanism.
* Pass `JDK-HOME` path for local depdencies.

name: v0.16.0
body:
* Annotating targets with the reason they were created:
  * Root requested dependency.
  * Required dependency by another dependency.
* Annotating targets with license information:
  * Name as shown in the pom file.
  * Type (Apache, MIT, etc).
  * URL to the license file.
* Failing if a root dependency was not found.

name: v0.15.0
body:
* Support for `kotlin-rules` 1.5.0-alpha3
* Verified with Bazel 4.0.0

name: v.0.14.3
body: * Fix for Kotlin jars that also contain java_plugin.

name: v0.14.2
body: * Fixed typo in generated files.

name: v0.14.1
body: * Better `buildifier` output.

name: v0.14.0
body: * Other than java-rules, all other rules must be provided. For example, if a dependency is an Android dependency and `aar_import` was not provided to the init macro (`generate_transitive_dependency_targets`) then the build will fail with an error message.

name: v0.13.2
body: * Support for java-plugins (annotation processors) with comments in their manifest.

name: v0.13.1
body:
* Verified with Bazel 3.3.1.
* Fix an issue with a specific malformed version structure.
* Avoid cyclic-dependency issues.

name: v0.13.0
body: * Support for updated kotlin_rules.

name: v0.12.0
body:
* Ability to provide a `java_library` and `java_plugin` rule implementations.
* Generated `BUILD.bazel` files are compliant to `buildifier`.

name: v0.11.0
body:
* Rules and `bzl` files were renamed to include `mabel`.
* You can now specify which version-conflict resolution strategy will be used. Use the `version_conflict_resolver` attribute
* A new version-conflict resolution strategy: `latest-version`. This is the default.

name: v0.10.2
body: * Fix for missing maven-coordinates tag

name: v0.10.1
body:
* Fix an issue with Kotlin rules and visibility
* Working with Bazel 3.1.0

name: v0.10.0
body: * Ability to specify the visibility of generated targets, according to a category.

name: v0.9.2
body: * Option to keep files in the target folder.

name: v0.9.1
body:
* Generate a `buildifer` complaint macros. Specifically, `docstring`.
* A friendlier name for the all-processor-classes target. It is not `processors` or `processors-with-api`.

name: v0.9.0
body:
* Removed dependency on protobuf.
  * This will result in a slightly slower merging phase - due to less compact data transfer protocol.
  * but faster bootstrap times - since we do not need to compile protobuf.
  * fewer workspace conflicts - by removing protobuf remote repository.

name: v0.8.1
body: * Additional verifications of produced graph.

name: v0.8.0
body:
* even smaller data exchange object.
* a few cosmetic log changes

name: v0.7.0
body:
* Completely re-write of data exchange layer (using Protobuf instead of json). This results in much faster and smaller data exchange before resolver and merger.
* Updated to Bazel 2.0.0.
